title: A Beginner's Guide to Selling on eBay
headline: Begin your business by laying the foundations required to develop a thriving shop on eBay with this free online course.
description: This course is for you if you're new to eBay and want to make a name for yourself or if you're an experienced seller looking to increase your earnings. From start to finish, you'll discover everything there is to know about selling on eBay, the world's largest online marketplace. It presents a fantastic opportunity for entrepreneurs, investors and internet retailers to sell things to eBay's 182 million active shoppers.

courseDescription:
Consumers are more likely to make recurring purchases from online marketplaces than from different retail channels when visiting the shopping mall. eBay is a gigantic internet-based e-commerce selling platform. Many successful firms have made their fortunes by selling on eBay. For example, the auctions, which allow users to sell odd products at a premium, is a unique feature that distinguishes eBay from other competitors. Understanding how eBay works will help you achieve your goals, whether you want to start an e-commerce business or get rid of old items. If you are new to eBay selling, we have included some recommendations to help you get started. If you want to be a successful eBay seller, we will broaden your knowledge and help you grasp specific marketing skills. As digital commerce advertising strategies have continued to develop, the author presents important guidelines for online vendors. Starting an eBay store is not as challenging as it may sound. It is just a matter of understanding the ‘rules of the road’.

There are about 17 million eBay vendors. On eBay, you can sell almost anything. To determine whether items are lucrative, perform a product research. We will go through booming product concepts, how to consider demand and other research elements that impact the return on the investment. Trevor Ginn, your lecturer, has been a skilled online retailing entrepreneur for nearly a decade. He has an eBay company selling over $500K annually. The course is distributed into two comprehensive modules, each focusing on a different facet of the eBay selling platform. Begin by setting up an eBay account that will allow you access to buy and sell. Then study the steps to perform the best research strategy and product selection. Even gain tips to find product ideas and learn to differentiate between auction-style and fixed-price selling. You will also learn how to set your listing and item pricing and become acquainted with handling listings that convert.

According to data, internet reviews influence 93% of purchase decisions and 72% of online consumers are willing to review a product as long as they do not violate the feedback extortion regulations. The higher your seller rating, the more likely customers will buy from you. This course seeks to lay the groundwork to establish a positive seller reputation on the eBay platform. Getting positive comments from customers will boost your market credibility. In the second module, you will uncover ways to enhance your listings' visibility. Then you'll learn how to evaluate the seller's key performance indicators. Learn how to use the eBay Promotions Manager to make your listings stand out to increase sales. Setting up an eBay business is simple. Entrepreneurs can sell both wholesale and retail items, as eBay sellers do. Selling on eBay is a terrific way to start your e-commerce adventure, whether you are cleaning your home, establishing a side hustle or replacing your existing wage. Enrol in the 'A Beginner's Guide to Selling on eBay' course to get started selling on eBay and earning money.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module explains how to use eBay to market your business. Acquire the knowledge you need to get started and use essential principles to apprehend everything from strategic branding to product specifics. You'll browse the Seller Hub and understand the 'Best Match' algorithm. And, you'll learn about the site policies that apply to your shop.
topics: Build your eBusiness on eBay - Learning Outcomes
Fundamentals of the eBay Product Management
Build your eBusiness on eBay - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module provides the framework for establishing and managing an eBay online business. Begin by learning how to process purchase orders and deliver goods. You'll also learn to deal with complaints, product returns, and conflicts. Finish with a series of short video lectures that will teach you how to employ profit-boosting ideas and procedures.
topics: eBay Business Management Essentials - Learning Outcomes
eBay Business Management Essentials - Lesson Summary

  • Lesson Summary

  • Why should your business sell on eBay?
    1. Millions of users worldwide with Billion live listings
    2. Massive international reach with buyers in 190 countries
    3. With 15000 product categories, you can sell almost anything on eBay!
    4. eBay is the only platform where you may sell products at an auction online.
    5. Great place for entrepreneurs to diversify their sales and find new customers
  • Branding for Online Businesses Best Practices
    • A company's brand is its name. It's the brand's visual identity, and it's an essential part of the total customer experience. Increased awareness, recognition, trust, and, ultimately, sales are all benefits of good branding.
    • When developing a brand, it is critical to consider who your target audience is. What kind of merchandise do you offer? What is your product's market niche? What distinguishes you?
    • Make a powerful first impression when clients visit your website or marketplace profile and employ your branding across your marketing platforms and social media to provide a consistent image across the web.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Access your eBay orders by clicking the 'Sell' button in the upper right corner. Then you'll see a list of all processed purchases through your seller account.
    • From the drop-down menu, you can sort them by various statuses. View all orders: awaiting payments, dispatched, those delayed on dispatch, those awaiting expedited delivery, those paid, and those pending feedback.
    • When handling your orders, you may purchase postage or add tracking information and even mark the transaction as shipped in real-time.
  • International and Domestic Postage for your eBay Listings
    • Access the creator item form, located on the Shipping option, under 'business policies.' There you select a postage policy created from the listing
    • For domestic and international you can set up to four postage services
    • Set a cost and a price per additional item. That is multiples of the same commodity.You can set up four zones when configuring international shipping.
    • You have the option of sending it through the global shipping service. If you select this option, overseas clients will send their purchases to a UK shipping centre, and eBay will handle the rest of the delivery.
